comments.body: How is this noarch generic if it has all of the mac-specific stuff?

This is a question for @conda-forge/r but basically the build scripts are pre-defined templates coming out of `conda_r_skeleton_helper` / `conda skeleton cran`, maybe `$R CMD INSTALL --build .` would suffice but I don't want to the change the templates as they are quite standard nowadays.

Yes, the build scripts come out of `conda skeleton cran`. The scripts enable that `noarch: generic` recipes can be built on all arches, even though they are built on linux after feedstock conversion. And yes, often `script: R CMD INSTALL --build .` would be enough, but that would currently be a manual change to the output of `conda_r_skeleton_helper / conda skeleton cran`.
If I recall correctly, Isuru (or someone else?) commented that it helps local debugging.

@scopatz @conda-forge/r Can we merge this? This seems to a more general discussion about R packages and not specific about this package as we merged a lot of similar recipes in the last weeks. Happy to change it afterwards but I think we should discuss this in an issue in https://github.com/bgruening/conda_r_skeleton_helper

@scopatz the @conda-forge/r team leaves all the pre-processor selectors there so people can build the `noarch` recipe on Windows. From a readability from of view I don't like* it but it has a use case.

* It makes it hard to review a recipe and figure out if it is really `noarch`. That is what just happened here BTW.

  number: 0
  noarch: generic

    - lib/R/lib/
